metadata.Title: CVE-2021-38199 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
fs/nfs/nfs4client.c in the Linux kernel before 5.13.4 has incorrectconnection-setup ordering, which allows operators of remote NFSv4 serversto cause a denial of service (hanging of mounts) by arranging for thoseservers to be unreachable during trunking detection.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-38199` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-162-generic - 4.15.0-162.170
linux-image-4.15.0-162-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-162.170
linux-image-4.15.0-162-lowlatency - 4.15.0-162.170
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-162-generic - 4.15.0-162.170
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-162-lowlatency - 4.15.0-162.170
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-87-generic - 5.4.0-87.98~18.04.1

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-162.170').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-87.98~18.04.1').
